name: scolding
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of speaking angrily to someone because you disapprove of their behaviour: He gave his son a scolding for coming home so late.
More examplesFewer examplesThey received an average of one encouragement for every two scoldings.If the scolding was meant to put him in his place, it failed.There were verbal scoldings, but that was about it. A child with his level of autism cannot process scolding.“I gave him the money,” my mom tells me anxiously over the phone, like a child who’s about to get a scolding.
